channel.title: SAP on Microsoft on SAP on Microsoft - Tutorials
channel.description: Recent content in SAP on Microsoft on SAP on Microsoft - Tutorials

item.title: Environment Setup
item.description: Before we start building our labs we need to have provisioned a few resources: An Azure subscription setup for SAP Cloud Appliance Library (SAP CAL) An existing S/4HANA environment or a trial deployed thru SAP CAL Installation of Microsoft Data Gateway components An account at the SAP Gateway Demo System for some integration examples The following sections will guide you thru the steps to accomplish this and be ready to the labs.

item.title: SAP on Microsoft Labs
item.description: The following sections will be divided in different labs integrating several Microsoft services with SAP, such as: Automation and Integration Azure Logic Apps Power Platform - Power Virtual Agents Power Platform - Power Automate Power Platform - Power Apps Data & AI Office 365 Integration Azure Synapse Power Platform - Power BI Azure Machine Learning Security Azure Sentinel Azure AD Infra & Management Azure Monitoring Azure Backup High-Availability The following sections will guide you thru the steps to accomplish this and be ready to the labs.

item.title: Environment Cleanup
item.description: Now that you have done all the labs, it is important to cleanup deployed resources. Below we will see the steps required for this process: SAP CAL Cleanup This process will remove all resources deployed by SAP into your Azure Subscription. This is a destructive process and in case you need to recover this environment, you can redeploy from scratch until the end of the SAP CAL Trial. Sign in to the SAP CAL and click on Log On.
